content.description: Starting from rest, students <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> push horizontally on identical statues that roll on carts with negligible friction across a level floor. At a given instant, the acceleration and velocity of the statue Student <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is pushing is <math alttext="lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>a</mi></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"> <mi>v</mi> </math>, respectively. At that same instant, the acceleration and velocity of the statue Student <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is pushing is <math alttext="one fourth lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>a</mi></math> and <math alttext="3 v" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>v</mi></math>, respectively, as shown. The instantaneous power delivered to the statue by students <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="P sub uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, respectively.
content.question: What is <math alttext="the fraction P sub uppercase A, end sub, over P sub B, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <mfrac> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </msub> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi> </msub> </mfrac> </math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
